column4: I want to make a copy of all of my . directories, so that I can wipe out the current ones and start fresh (except for a couple), how do I do that? If I do cp .* it copies all files (. being the current directory).
maybe cp .??* DESTINATION
that'll copy all dotfiles with 2 or more characters after the dot... so not ..
Assuming you don't want anything that's in your Trash, yes
I don't think you need .dbus. dbus will make a new one if it needs one

and others, thanks for your help, it is working now. I must have been mistaken before. The first account I log into will have the nm-applet running, no other accounts can run it if the first account runs it (which I guess makes sense because two users can't user two different wireless connections).
you might have missed my message when you left, but thanks for your help, it is working!
Awesome! What ended up fixing it?

well, I think I must have been mistaken before, but I'm not sure, I guess nm-applet can only run in one account at a time, so I think that means if the first user logs in and locks their account and the second user needs to change to a different wireless network, they won't be able to.
ah, I see. That's dumb of it...
lol. Yeah, that makes searching for info on the skill command difficult >.>
hehe, yeah
will wicd work under two accounts at the same time?
No idea, I haven't tried it
okay, maybe I'll give it a try and see what I think :) I'm sure it will be better than network manager either way
Installation instructions are in http://wicd.sourceforge.net/download.php . It's not in the repositories, unfortunately :(
okay, thanks, looks easy enough anyhow ;)
my ISP is... irritating.
lol, it's like you are here and chencaifa disappears, and then you disappear and chencaifa comes back
lol. Well, I should be around for a while, so maybe we'll never see chencaifa again =/
odd, I usually run bash scripts in my terminal, not my IRC client =P
woah, you can do that???
